title: datalad update didn't actually update superdataset with new state for a child

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
``` shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/datasets/datalad/test-crawled2/all-5/indi/fcon1000[master]git
$> datalad update
2016-08-11 23:51:16,550 [INFO   ] Updating dataset '/mnt/datasets/datalad/test-crawled2/all-5/indi/fcon1000' ... (update.py:115)
(venv-tests)2 10875.....................................:Thu 11 Aug 2016 11:51:16 PM EDT:.
(git)smaug:/mnt/datasets/datalad/test-crawled2/all-5/indi/fcon1000[master]git
$> ls
AnnArbor_a/  Beijing_Zang/       Durham_Madden/  Milwaukee_a/  NewYork_Test-Retest_Reliability/  Ontario/     Pittsburgh/
AnnArbor_b/  Berlin_Margulies/   ICBM/           Milwaukee_b/  NewYork_a/                        Orangeburg/  Queensland/
Atlanta/     Cambridge_Buckner/  Leiden_2180/    Munchen/      NewYork_a_ADHD/                   Oulu/        SaintLouis/
Baltimore/   Cleveland\ CCF/     Leiden_2200/    NewHaven_a/   NewYork_b/                        Oxford/      Taipei_a/
Bangor/      Dallas/             Leipzig/        NewHaven_b/   Newark/                           PaloAlto/    Taipei_b/


(venv-tests)2 10876.....................................:Thu 11 Aug 2016 11:51:18 PM EDT:.
(git)smaug:/mnt/datasets/datalad/test-crawled2/all-5/indi/fcon1000[master]git
$> git status
On branch master
Your branch is behind 'origin/master' by 1 commit, and can be fast-forwarded.
  (use "git pull" to update your local branch)
nothing to commit, working directory clean
```

where `git pull --ff-only` did it

``` shell
$> git pff
Updating 9829816..b486fc3
Fast-forward
 Baltimore | 2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)
changes on filesystem:
 Baltimore | 2 +-
(venv-tests)2 10879.....................................:Thu 11 Aug 2016 11:51:31 PM EDT:.
(git)smaug:/mnt/datasets/datalad/test-crawled2/all-5/indi/fcon1000[master]git
$> 
changes on filesystem:                                                                                                           
 Baltimore | 2 +-
```
